Name: Naming of Joel A. Miele, Sr. Pedestrian Bridge.
Title: A Local Law in relation to the naming of Joel A. Miele, Sr. Pedestrian Bridge.

History.Action: Hearing on P-C Item by Comm
History.Description: This Introduction was Hearing on P-C Item by Comm
A motion was made that this Introduction be P-C Item Approved by Comm approved by Roll Call.
This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Parks and Recreation
A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
This Introduction was Sent to Mayor by Council
This Introduction was City Charter Rule Adopted
History.MinutesNote: This bill was returned unsigned on Monday, June 26, 2017 (31st day was on Saturday, June 24, 2017).

Attachments.Name: Minutes of the Recessed Stated Meeting of May 10, 2017 held on May 24, 2017
May 24, 2017 - Stated Meeting Agenda with Links to Files
Minutes of the Recessed Stated Meeting of May 24, 2017 held on June 6, 2017
Minutes of the Stated Meeting - May 24, 2017

Summary: This bill will rename the 163rd Avenue Pedestrian Bridge in the Borough of Queens, Joel A. Miele, Sr. Pedestrian Bridge, and amend the official City map accordingly.
Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:

	Section 1. The following bridge name, in the Borough of Queens, is hereby designated as hereafter indicated. Such name change shall be reflected on the city map if such bridge is located and laid out on such map.  

New Name
 Present Name 
Joel A. Miele, Sr. Pedestrian Bridge
163rd Avenue Pedestrian Bridge 

	ï¿½2. This local law shall take effect immediately.

PM
LS # 10761
5/12/17
